alert.note: Alert for Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 24 at 4:13AM AKST until January 24 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and freezing rain occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches, highest amounts in the Denali State Park area. Ice accumulation up to one tenth of an inch, mainly south of Talkeetna. * WHERE...Susitna Valley. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will taper off from south to north late this evening, lingering longest in Denali State Park and northward up the Parks Highway to Broad Pass. Areas of rain and freezing rain will impact areas south of Talkeetna this morning. Southerly winds will move up the valley this morning, leading to temperatures warming above freezing, though rain falling on snow covered roads will still produce slippery conditions. Additional light rain is possible this afternoon over the southern valley before drying out this evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
